awd_titl_txt: Conference: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2023 IEEE Workshop on Wide Bandgap Power Devices and Applications (WiPDA)
awd_abstract_narration:
This is a student travel grant for the 2023 IEEE Workshop on Wide Bandgap Power Devices and Applications (WiPDA). This workshop has served as a conduit for the exchange of innovative ideas, groundbreaking research findings, and practical insights in the field of wide bandgap power electronics and its applications for several years. Attendees of this workshop will gain unparalleled access to renowned professionals, enabling them to explore the frontiers of power electronics and align their academic endeavors with real-world industry demands. The workshop agenda, including tutorials, technical sessions, panels, and exhibitions, will provide students with transformative experiences that bridge the gap between academia and industry. The broader impacts of the workshop will include convergence of research communities in power electronics and power systems, and also workforce development in the broad areas of clean energy.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
Project Overview:

The NSF Student Travel Grant for the 2023 IEEE Workshop on Wide Bandgap Power Devices and Applications (WiPDA) provided financial support to 12 students, enabling them to attend one of the premier international workshops focused on advancing wide bandgap (WBG) power devices and applications. This initiative aimed to broaden participation by reducing financial barriers and fostering professional growth through engagement with industry and academic leaders.

WiPDA 2023 welcomed over 165 attendees, with approximately 50% from industry and the remainder from academia, creating a dynamic and collaborative environment. This unique mix provided students with invaluable exposure to the latest research breakthroughs, industry trends, and career opportunities, equipping them with the knowledge and connections essential for their future contributions to the field.

 

Intellectual Merit

The WiPDA workshop serves as a premier venue for advancing wide bandgap (WBG) power devices, bringing together experts from academia and industry. The NSF-supported students gained exposure to cutting-edge research through technical sessions, tutorials, and panel discussions, deepening their understanding of GaN and SiC technologies. Their participation fostered knowledge exchange, innovation, and interdisciplinary collaboration, contributing to the advancement of high-efficiency power electronics.

Broader Impacts

This initiative broadened participation by supporting students in STEM and power electronics. By engaging with leading companies and researchers, students gained valuable industry insights and professional connections, strengthening the future U.S. workforce in power electronics. Their experience will have a ripple effect, influencing peers and institutions while advancing sustainable energy solutions.
